name: Mr Pietro Carlomagno
goal:
Far-back Mr Pietro Carlomagno is also interested in European Policies, following the political and regulatory developments of Commission and European Parliament, organizing and participating thanks to cultural and associations at some conferences and events aimed at the dissemination of European fundamentals and the development of Europe, attracting interest of all stakeholders, citizens, businesses and public administrations.

Particular focus is on European funding opportunities supporting local authorities, businesses and non-profit entities that are interested in EU programmes connected to EU grants:
1) direct management (managed directly by the European Commission) such as Horizon 2020 and the Competitiveness of Enterprises and Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (COSME), LIFE + and EU Programme for Employment and Social Innovation (EaSI);
2) shared management (managed jointly by the EU and Member States) such as European programmes of Lombardy Region (or any other Region) in particular PON, ERDF and EDF.

Our working areas:

- culture;
- tourism;
- research and development;
- media;
- health;
- patents.

Always monitoring attentively at European Institutions.

Last business consulting activities on European funding were focused on the following topics: Cohesion fund (2018CE16) - Support for information measures relating to the EU Cohesion policy, CULT-COOP-09-2017 - European cultural heritage, access and analysis for a richer interpretation of the past (within the call "Horizon 2020 - Understanding Europe - Promoting the European Public and Cultural Space"), Altiero Spinelli Prize for Outreach: Spreading Knowledge about Europe, SMEInst-11-2016-2017 - Boosting the potential of small businesses in the areas of climate action, environment, resource efficiency and raw materials and SMEInst-01-206-2017 - Open Disruptive Innovation Scheme (within the call "Horizon 2020 - Innovation in SMEs").
interests: Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Environment, General and Institutional Affairs, International co-operation and development, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
Main activities are still under preparation and we will focus on:

- lobby activities to influence policymaking, policy implementation and/or the EU institutions' decision-making process;
- involvement with Commissioners, EU civil servants, Members of the European Parliament (MEPs) or their assistants, to represent an interest or position;
- events or forums dealing with EU policies/processes, invitations to which have been sent to Commissioners, MEPs and their assistants or EU officials;
- research on EU activities and policies, involving regular contact with the EU institutions and feeding into the EU policy-making process.

Our working area will be the following fields:

- Audiovisual and Media;
- Consumer Affairs;
- Culture;
- Development;
- Economic and Financial Affairs;
- Education;
- Enterprise;
- Environment;
- General and Institutional Affairs;
- Home Affairs;
- Internal Market;
- Public Health;
- Research and Technology;
- Trade;
- Transport;
- Youth.
